title: Tearful mum says car park staff refused to let her leave to collect daughter, 2
text:

A mum who lost a parking ticket has slammed staff for allegedly refusing to let her leave to collect her daughter from nursery.

Maria Bensley had been to the gym and parked in Gracechurch Centre car park in Sutton Coldfield, West Midlands.

The desperate mum said she ended up pleading with staff after mislaying her parking ticket and having no means to pay to get out to fetch her two-year-old daughter.

Usually gym members can validate their ticket and get their parking for free.

The 33-year-old mum eventually called her husband who managed to contact management and end the stand-off last Thursday.

Maria said: “I was told I wasn’t being let out and was left crying, with my daughter left with no one to pick her up.

"The Gracechurch car park man... (was) saying he couldn’t lift the barrier without a ticket.”

The mum phoned her husband who offered to pay by card but claimed staff refused to give her a number to make payment, reports Birmingham Live.

Maria, who runs a children’s catering business, said: “I got in the Gracechurch Centre car park about 11.50am on Thursday.

“I usually have my ticket in my coat pocket or in my gym bag but I mislaid it. I don’t take my purse.

“I was there just under an hour. I hadn’t validated the ticket at the gym because I’d lost it before I’d left. I’d looked in the gym locker and my bag. I looked everywhere for it.

“It has happened once before. Probably about a year ago. I pressed the buzzer and a woman checked my registration number. You’re only allowed two hours parking when you go to the gym. And I was let out.

“I thought I will just do the same as before. I pressed the help button. They said ‘you are going to have to come in and pay’. I said I didn’t have any money on me and they told me I would have to pay some way.”

Maria spoke to a ‘young guy’ in the office and another staff member who she says refused to tell her who was in charge or give her any numbers to call to make a payment.

The tearful mum was increasingly desperate and called the police who said it was a civil matter.

At 1.10pm Maria called the nursery, in tears, to say she was going to be late - before her husband ended the crisis.

She said: “My husband managed to the number of his boss in London. His boss then called the man in the car park and all of a sudden he said ‘just this once, I will take your details and let you go.

“I said to him ‘You made me go through all of this. Getting me all worked up and leaving my daughter stranded.'"

Maria left the car park at around 1.45pm – around an hour after she was meant to and headed to Little Explorers Nursery in Streetly. The nursery waived any additional fee.

She has been a member at The Gym Group in Sutton for three years and said: “I just can’t believe there’s people out there who have got no heart.

“I don’t want to go back.”

Angela Henderson, centre manager at the Gracechurch Centre said: “We value all of our customers at The Gracechurch Centre and as part of this always seek to ensure the smooth running of the car park with clear signage about tariffs and our lost ticket policy – which we introduced following a spate of lost tickets last year.

“We are sorry to hear of Ms Bensley’s experience. We take the issues raised seriously and are fully investigating the matter.

"We are also liaising with our whole team, as we do regularly, to reiterate our customer service led approach.”
description: Maria Bensley, 33, was left in tears after claiming staff at the car park in Sutton Coldfield, West Midlands, held her there for an hour while she was desperate to collect her daughter from nursery
